result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Tyrone Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Victor Tyrone Reese is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Victor Tyrone Reese was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision in case # 14CF3775.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Consecutive to: at the Day Reporting Center with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  The Court stayed commencement until 07/24/2015 at 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Tyrone Reese

Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections at the Day Reporting Center with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVEto any other sentence.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  The Court stayed commencement until 07/24/2015 at 5pm.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision in case# 14CF3775.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 1 and 3 are DISMISSED.  As to Count 2:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Due to court being down the remainder of the week, violation will be address at next court date of 05/20/2015.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense moved to join case numbers 14CF3775 and 15CF248. Arguments heard. Court denied State's motion. Case adjourned to Branch 22.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Court will address at the next court date.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Victor Tyrone Reese not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Medical documents dated 04/07/15 in regards to the missed Court appearance recieved and filed. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defendant failing to appear for reasons stated on the record. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Defendant ordered to bring proof of hospitalization.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status Conference adjourned to April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM016344  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-27-15
For reasons stated on the record, Court increases bail to $2,300 ($2,000 previously posted, $300 remains due).  All other conditions of bail previously set remain.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.
  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, and amends bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for status on 04/07/2015 at 1:30.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant was ordered to report to Branch 22 immediately.  Defense attorney was not available.  Case calendared for bail review in Branch 22 on 03/27/2015 at 8:30am.
State's Motion to Join for Trial received and filed.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  This case will follow 14CF3775, which was set for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court addresses GPS violations from the weekend and advises client that any future violations will likely result in an increase in bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Court will not take action at this time.

Court orders the curfew modified to 8pm to 7am.  (24 hour curfew is canceled) 
Court allows the defendant to coordinate a move of residence and provide his new address to Justice Point and the court.
Court amends cash bail down to $2000.  $500 to be returned to whomever posted it.  All other conditions of bail previously set remain with the exceptions listed.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail review and scheduling.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the defense motion to 1.) Amend cash bail and return $500 to whomever posted it.  2.) Modify the 24 curfew to 8pm to 7am.  3.) Allow the defendant to coordinate a move and provide his new address.  Defense requests more time, case remains calendared in Branch 22.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22 due to lower pending Felony matter.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/23/15.

15RM001846  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-15-2015
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring(24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Victor Tyrone Reese in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
